 almost too embarrassed to throw this out there, but studying species 
exti=
nctions and listening to my professor (the head of a prestigious Institute =

e 
parts of the global ecosystem that WE need to survive,=C2=A0 I sometimes=

sometimes wonder if we're just a hybri=

 just waiting to move on.

<P>I'm almost too embarrassed to throw this =
out there, but studying species extinctions and listening to my professor (=
the head of a prestigious Institute studying sustainability issues, who bel=
ieves we might be able to retail the parts of the global ecosystem that WE =
need to survive,  I sometimes wonder who WE are.  Are we from her=
e?  ( I know. - that's very SyFi channel but when I think of the alleg=
ed superadvanced and long extinct cultures of the past and our collective "=
disposable" attitude toward what's left of our natural resources I sometime=
s wonder if we're just a hybrid, an experiment or we have some deeply subco=
nscious awareness that we are just waiting to move on.</P>
<P>Ok, that's my=
 "fringe"/whaling contribution for the day.</P>
<P>Adrienne </P>
